TopicTitle: [Quick-thread] Favorite Feature Added in an Update?

Articles.Content:
This is just a small "Quick-thread" where you post your favorite feature added in any update and then support why you think it is your favorite.

My favorite has to be when they made it where jets use intake air. I was a huge fan of the spaceplane hanger and spent most of my time prior to this feature in it. It added another step towards realism and made it more challenging to build reliable planes.

Hmmm.. favorite feature from any update.. let's see umm..

.17, back when they added planets! yep! we only had minmus and mun to explore, after we got really bored of these two celestial bodies we had a whole new solar system to explore! YAYYYYYYYY!!

I remember I was jumping around in the house... literally...

I liked when they added the Mun, so there was somewhere to go.

The runner up is when they added docking.

i really like the girders that they added in 0.19. Those are nice

Docking is a close second

The Space Center updates/upgrades. It's fun to fly around the buildings.

Edited October 20, 2013 by DisarmingBaton5
aw... strikethrough doesn't exist?
maneuver nodes. made planning burns a lot easer and by experimenting with them you could learn a lot about orbital mechanics.
I yhink i would agree with SargeRho, the .18 update added Docking and nodes, and the recend .22 update both added gamplay changing features.

Probes! Docking! Electricity! An entire art pass! Many new parts! Stations! Maneuver nodes! Apollo-style!

.18 was a killer update.
My favorite update was either .18 or .20 .18 as it was my first update of the full version of the game, .20 becuse of all then new features/SAS logic.

I really like the subassemblies in this mod.

But ofc things like planets and docking opened a whole new universe.
My favorite is the performance improvement of 0.22. Infinitely better.

Planets.

... Some place to go... interesting orbital situations to get into.

So far docking is my favorite feature by a long shot. It just extends what you can accomplish so much. Though the tech tree and science system have opened up a new bit of fun in that they give me a chance to do my favorite pastime of breaking the difficulty curve of any game I touch.
